function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Environmental and climatic conditions contributing to the upsurge of vector-borne diseases (VBD) such as WNF and malaria in Southeast Europe.","Impact":"Increased transmission and spread of vector-borne diseases, posing a public health threat.","Mitigation":"Implementing advanced vector control measures, improving surveillance and monitoring systems, and enhancing public awareness of the risks.","Technologies":"Advanced surveillance technologies, predictive modeling for disease forecast, genetic modification for vector control.","People":"Local communities, migrant workers, travelers, and residents in Southeast Europe.","Owner":"Public health agencies, environmental organizations, government agencies."},{"Description":"Social inequality as a factor in the emergence and transmission cycle of malaria in Greece, particularly among migrant workers from endemic countries.","Impact":"Increased risk of malaria transmission, higher disease burden, and public health disparities.","Mitigation":"Addressing social determinants of health, providing access to healthcare and preventive measures, and conducting targeted interventions for at-risk populations.","Technologies":"Telemedicine for remote healthcare access, mobile health apps for monitoring and education, data analytics for identifying high-risk areas.","People":"Migrant workers, local communities, public health officials, and policymakers.","Owner":"Healthcare providers, public health agencies, non-governmental organizations."},{"Description":"Inadequacy of traditional public health strategies to cope with the public health challenges associated with global environmental change and emergence of VBD in the European Union.","Impact":"Ineffective disease control, potential outbreaks, and public health crises.","Mitigation":"Developing and implementing innovative public health strategies, integrating environmental and climatic data into disease surveillance, and strengthening international collaborations for disease control.","Technologies":"Big data analytics for environmental monitoring, geospatial technology for mapping disease spread, remote sensing for early detection of environmental changes.","People":"Public health officials, policymakers, researchers, and international health organizations.","Owner":"Public health agencies, research institutions, international health organizations."}]}
